average speed =   .........  m/s

work done =
unit

A girl is cycling along a straight horizontal road
Fig. 1.1 shows the **directions** of the forces acting on the cyclist as she cycles in the direction of force C

Fig. 2.2 shows the force applied to the sign by the man

moment =   .........  Ncm

Suggest how to change the base so that the sign is more stable. Explain your answer
suggestion
explanation

State the energy store for the water behind the dam

**boiler** **cooling tower** **generator** **solar cell** **turbine**

Give two reasons why the power station uses high voltages to transmit electrical energy over long distances
Hydroelectric power stations may replace coal-fired power stations

advantages
disadvantages
Fig. 3.1 represents a hydroelectric power station transmitting electrical energy to homes and factories far away

solid gas

In a different ripple tank, the wavelength of the wave is \(5.1 \text{cm}\)

frequency =   .........  \(Hz\)

The ray of red light is refracted at point P

A ray of blue light replaces the ray of red light. The angle of incidence for the blue ray entering the prism is the same as in Fig. 7.1

Another ray enters the glass prism and is totally internally reflected
State two conditions for a ray to be totally internally reflected

resistance =   .........  \(\Omega\)

power transferred =
unit

Complete Table 9.1 by adding a suitable metal for each part. Choose from the metals in the list
Each metal can be used once, more than once or not at all

The primary coil has 1500 turns and the secondary coil has 650 turns
Calculate the output voltage of the secondary coil
output voltage =   .........  V
State the number of protons in an atom of protactinium-234. ......................................
State the number of nucleons in an atom of protactinium-234. ........................................
The nuclide notation for an atom of protactinium-234 is:
Three forms of the element protactinium are: protactinium-234, protactinium-230 and protactinium-233
State the name given to these different forms of the same element
The sample emits beta \((\beta)\) -particles
State the nature of a beta \((\beta)\) -particle
The teacher obtains data for a decay curve. Fig. 10.1 shows the decay curve for the sample of protactinium-234m
Calculate the half-life of protactinium-234m using the information in Fig. 10.1. Clearly show your working on the graph or in the space provided
half-life =   .........  s

A teacher demonstrates radioactive decay by using a sample of protactinium-234m

content.text: The Solar System contains a number of objects. Some of these objects are listed
Write these objects in order of their size
smallest

content.text: State what redshift indicates about the movement of distant galaxies
State why redshift in the light from distant galaxies supports the Big Bang Theory
Redshift is an increase in the observed wavelength of the light emitted from distant galaxies
Define one light-year
Scientists can send spacecraft to planets. There are many planets outside the Solar System
Suggest one reason, other than cost, why scientists do **not** send spacecraft to planets outside the Solar System
An electromagnetic wave travels from the Sun to the Earth in a time of 500 s
The speed of the electromagnetic wave in space is \(3.0 \times 10^{8} \text{m / s}\)
Calculate the distance between the Sun and the Earth
